document.masterDocTitle: The matchstick grasshopper genus Warramaba (Morabidae: Morabinae): a description of four new species and a photographic guide to the group

Etymology: NAmED AfTER THE CYTOGENETICIST M. J. D. WHITE .

Biology: THIS SPECIES mAY OCCUR SYmPATRICALLY wITH
W. flavolineata
sp. nov.
AND
W. picta
AND, AT SOmE SITES, CAN bE fOUND ON THE SAmE fOOD PLANTS. IT HAS ALSO bEEN fOUND IN SYmPATRY wITH
W. grandis
sp. nov.
AT ONE SITE IN THE fAR wEST Of ITS RANGE. IT OCCURS ON SHRUbS AND TREES Of THE GENERA
Acacia
AND Senna . THIS SPECIES IS STRONGLY GENETICALLY DIffERENTIATED ACROSS ITS RANGE (KEARNEY AND BLACkET 2008 ).
